topic.topic_name: Relationships of organisms with one another and with the environment

learning_objectives.description: Understand that the Sun is the principal source of energy input to most biological systems
Explain why most forms of life are completely dependent on photosynthesis
Describe the flow of energy through food chains and webs including energy from light and energy in living organisms and its eventual transfer to the environment
Construct and interpret simple food chains
Understand the terms producer, consumer, herbivore, carnivore and decomposer
Describe food webs as networks of interconnected food chains and construct and interpret them
Explain why the transfer of energy from one trophic level to another is inefficient
Explain why food chains usually have fewer than five trophic levels
Explain why it is more energy efficient for humans to eat crop plants than to eat livestock that have been fed on crop plants
Construct and interpret pyramids of numbers, biomass and energy
